dublin_core.dcvalue: Reference librarians developed an assessment tool to determine if formal classroom instruction on the use of PDAs benefits medical students The questionnaire on PDA concepts and skills designed to assess both comfort level and self described skill level was administered to students before and after a mandatory hands on PDA class Of 105 students surveyed 90 85 7 felt the class was immediately beneficial Mean scores on all questions increased from pre session to post session Score increases were statistically significant p Under 05 for almost all questions demonstrating to faculty students and instructors that the PDA class is beneficial necessary and should remain mandatory
Does instruction in the use of personal digital assistants increase medical students' comfort and skill level?
